# Convex Optimization

## Introduction

Convex optimization is the study of minimizing convex functions over convex sets. The theory is elegant and the algorithms are efficient, making convex optimization a cornerstone of modern applied mathematics.

## Convex Sets and Functions

::: {#def-convex-set}
## Convex Set
A set $C \subseteq \R^n$ is **convex** if for all $\bx, \by \in C$ and $\theta \in [0, 1]$:
$$
\theta \bx + (1 - \theta) \by \in C
$$
:::

::: {#def-convex-function}
## Convex Function
A function $f: \R^n \to \R$ is **convex** if for all $\bx, \by \in \R^n$ and $\theta \in [0, 1]$:
$$
f(\theta \bx + (1 - \theta) \by) \leq \theta f(\bx) + (1 - \theta) f(\by)
$$
:::

## Optimality Conditions

::: {#thm-first-order}
## First-Order Optimality
Let $f: \R^n \to \R$ be convex and differentiable. Then $\bx^*$ is a global minimizer if and only if:
$$
\nabla f(\bx^*) = \mathbf{0}
$$
:::

::: {#thm-second-order}
## Second-Order Condition
A twice-differentiable function $f$ is convex if and only if its Hessian is positive semidefinite everywhere:
$$
\nabla^2 f(\bx) \succeq 0 \quad \text{for all } \bx
$$
:::

## Quadratic Programming

::: {#def-qp}
## Quadratic Program
A **quadratic program** (QP) is an optimization problem of the form:
$$
\begin{aligned}
\min_{\bx} \quad & \frac{1}{2} \bx^\top \mathbf{P} \bx + \mathbf{q}^\top \bx \\
\text{s.t.} \quad & \bA \bx = \mathbf{b} \\
& \mathbf{G} \bx \leq \mathbf{h}
\end{aligned}
$$
The problem is convex if $\mathbf{P} \succeq 0$.
:::

## Exercises

::: {#exr-least-squares}
## Least Squares as QP
Show that the least squares problem $\min_\bx \norm{\bA\bx - \mathbf{b}}^2$ is a convex QP and derive the normal equations.
:::
